H0.text: Cancer is a result of abnormal cell division in humans.

H1.text: Fertilization is a result of abnormal cell division in humans.

H2.text: Asexual reproduction can result from abnormal cell division in humans.

H3.text: Dynamic equilibrium is what abnormal cell division in humans may result in.

A4.text: The transformation of a normal cell into cancer is akin to a chain reaction caused by initial errors, which compound into more severe errors, each progressively allowing the cell to escape more controls that limit normal tissue growth.

A5.text: If the error control processes fail, then the mutations will survive and be passed along to daughter cells.
